Leonardo da Vinci: I would bring Leonardo da Vinci back to life because of his incredible genius and multitude of talents. He was not only an artist, but also an inventor, scientist, and mathematician. Imagine the possibilities and discoveries he could make if he were alive today.

Marie Curie: Marie Curie was a pioneering scientist who made groundbreaking discoveries in the field of radioactivity. Bringing her back to life would allow her to continue her research and make even more significant contributions to the scientific community.

Cleopatra: Cleopatra was a powerful and intelligent queen who ruled Egypt for many years. She was known for her strategic thinking and diplomatic skills. Bringing her back to life would allow her to use her knowledge and experience to navigate the complex political landscape of today.

Mahatma Gandhi: Mahatma Gandhi was a leader who inspired millions of people through his nonviolent resistance movement. Bringing him back to life would allow him to continue to spread his message of peace and equality, and to help bring about positive change in the world.

William Shakespeare: William Shakespeare was a playwright and poet who is widely regarded as one of the greatest writers in the English language. Bringing him back to life would allow him to continue to write and create works of art that have stood the test of time.
